0.cdata!:
Appuyer les reformes de la gouvernance
            et la creation de debouches en Tunisie

theme: Participation and civic engagement,Other human development,Other accountability/anti-corruption,Other Private Sector Development,Improving labor markets

abstracts.cdata!:
Immediately following the revolution in
            Tunisia, the Bank quickly prepared and disbursed an US$500
            million Development Policy Loan (DPL). The DPL provided
            budgetary support which helped the Interim Government
            address the short-term financing needs and meet the demands
            of the January uprising. The reform measures supported by
            the DPL marked a clear break from the past and set the
            foundations of a new Tunisia. A number of reforms have been
            instituted lifting restrictions on access to information,
            allowing for greater citizen participation, and increasing
            transparency and accountability.
